STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS REGARDING THE RIGHT TO CLAIM AN ESTATE
(1) The right to claim an estate as a decedent's heir against a possessor in good faith shall lapse within a year of the heir learning of his or her right and of the possessor of the part of the estate he or she is claiming, and at the latest within ten years of the decedent's death in the case of an intestate heir and of the proclamation of the will in the case of a testamentary heir.
(2) In cases involving a possessor in bad faith, the right shall lapse within twenty years.
